summary.p: 254 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 3; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 25 lines per page; Dimensions: 170 x 270mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 26f: "79 E. H. 3 Mushaf. Aharlı esmer kâğıt. 270mm boy ve 170mm eninde 254 yaprak. Sahifede 120mm uzunluğunda kûfi yaziyle 25 satır. Tahminen VI. (XII) asırda istinsah edilmiş. Y. 1b, 2a, 2b, 3a sahifeleri Arap üslûbunda müzehheptir. Fatiha suresi ile Bakara suresinin başı Eyyubi üslûbunda müzehhep çerçeve içindedir. Sure isimleri yaldızla yazılı, sahife kenarlarındaki güllür müzehhep ve tezyınatlıdır. Sahifeler çok kirlenmiş ve yıpranmış ve tamir edilmiştir. Cildi miklep kabartma ve yaldız ve şemseli vişne çürüğü renginde deri Osmanlı eseridir."

This can be translated as follows: "79 E. H. 3 Muṣḥaf. Sized brown paper. 254 leaves of 270 mm height and 170 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 25 lines measuring 120 mm. Probably copied during 6th (12th) century. [Leaf] L. 1b, 2a, 2b and 3a leaves are illuminated in Arabic style. The beginning of the Q 1 (Sūra al-Fātiḥa) and the Q 2 (Sūra al-Baqara) are illuminated in the Ayyubi style within an gilded frame. The names of the sūras are written in gold, and the roses in the edges are gilded and illuminated. The folios have become heavily soiled and worn and have been restored. An Ottoman work of cherry brown leather binding with flap (miklep) and golden embossing mandorla (şemse).”
